metadata.title: CVE-2021-23963 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: When sharing geolocation during an active WebRTC share, Firefox could have reset the webRTC sharing state in the user interface, leading to loss of control over the currently granted permission. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 85.

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '85.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
